snippet: American companies are making more money than ever, but workers’ salaries have been at the lowest percentage of the gross domestic product since 1929.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column observes companies in United States are making more than ever, but workers' salaries do not reflect success or profits; salaries are at lowest percentage of gross domestic product since 1929.
lead_paragraph: American companies are making more money than ever, but workers’ salaries have been at the lowest percentage of the gross domestic product since 1929.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Companies Thrive As Workers Fall Behind
headline.main: U.S. Companies Thrive as Workers Fall Behind
